results.name: Beginner Public Speaking Academy CUSTOM COACHING + PRACTICE + VIDEO FEEDBACK

results.description:
Talk 1: How We Spiked the HBS water supply with Solr 


This presentation is a case study of how Harvard Business School IT built a Solr-driven search-based portal for HBS Alumni, and buoyed by this successful implementation of Solr, how we are expanding its use to other areas of the Enterprise. You will hear about how choosing the Solr approach saved us a ton of custom development, and enabled us to offer end-users features such as personalization, faceted search and navigation of various types of content (e.g., people, events, alumni stories), autocomplete, and a geolocation mapping UI for navigating the people directory. In addition to a demo of the end-user UI, the talk will outline technical implementation details—these will include how we modeled the content in the database to work with Solr, developed a “search wrapper” to handle access control by brokering the requests/responses between the UI layer and Solr, and developed a custom Java loader to import content from our RDBMS into Solr. In short, this talk will describe the path we took in adopting Solr, speed bumps and potholes we hit along the way, where we are currently, and what the future roadmap looks like for using Solr in the HBS Enterprise. 

Talk 2: "Stump The Chump" 

Chris "Hoss" Hostetter was the first ever Solr user at CNET Networks in 2005, helping to define what Solr was and what it eventually became at the Apache Software Foundation. At the first ever "Lucene Revolution" in Boston, Hoss was the first ever "Chump" at the first ever "Stump The Chump!" session. 5 years and 8 hot seats later, Hoss is returning to Boston and will look back at some of the most interesting Solr questions he's ever been asked. Time permitting, there will be also be a Q&A giving everyone a chance to "Stump The Chump!"

Speaker Bios: 

Ravi Mynampaty is just another search guy. He believes that making incremental changes is an effective path towards improving search and tries to make this happen on a daily basis. He is currently working on Enterprise Search at HBS, which includes setting Enterprise Search strategy, design and implementation of findability standards, search tools, and search user interfaces. Ravi has masters degree in engineering from the University of Massachusetts and Brandeis University.

Katia Muser currently works as Technical Solution Architect at HBS.  She is a seasoned IT professional and has designed effective software solutions in various verticals such as higher-ed, insurance, finance, and automotive industries.  Most recently, she architected a Solr-driven search-based portal for HBS Alumni.  Katia has an M.S. in Mathematics and Computer Science from EPF Ecole d'Ingénieurs in France.

Chris Hostetter (aka Hoss) is a Lucene/Solr Committer, and Lucene/Solr PMC Member for the Apache Software Foundation. He was previously Principal Software Engineer at CBSi/CNET.
results.name: "Stump The Chump" retrospective: The Trickiest Solr Questions Answered

group.name: Boston Apache Lucene and Solr Meetup

results.description:
Shop with Purpose - A Networking Evening at Lord & Taylor

Join us at Lord & Taylor for a "Business Balance" networking event, and learn how to shop - and dress- with purpose.  The evening will include informal networking with drinks, bites, a "Goodie Bag", L&T discounts  and a presentation by Doreen Dove – Image Consultant ~ Author ~ Stylist.

Doreen will share insider secrets on how to navigate Lord & Taylor and shop with purpose!  As an award-winning expert in the field of Image Consulting, Doreen Dove coaches women to use style as a tool to take strategic control of their image and fully engage in the possibilities of their future. She is a highly qualified image consultant, personal stylist, dynamic speaker and author who guides women through the process of identifying the right clothing to enhance not only their image, but also their self-confidence. 

You will receive an in-store coupon with a discount. We will be sure to leave shopping time so wear comfortable shoes!  Doreen will be selling her book Confidence Is Always In Style –  a savvy guide to all things stylish!  

Agenda

Check-in (First Floor) - 5:30 
Informal Networking, Refreshments and Presentation - 6:00 to 8:00

Non-members - $20.00

Register on our website 

Boston Women Connect thanks Lord & Taylor and Rose Meade for their sponsorship of a terrific evening!

results.name: Cryptoparty

results.description:
$20 to attend. Please be on time and sign up only if you're positive you can be present.


In this workshop we'll read your work and give you constructive suggestions to strengthen it. From larger structural and character considerations to minor formatting and story bumps, we'll help you make your script tighter, evocative, and more compelling. 


Please bring at least four copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.


Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! At least four would be appreciated.

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy / Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.

results.description:
Join us for a discussion on "Keys to Getting Press!" 


A story in the right publication or blog can be a boon to your business, but how do you even get a story?

Whether it's announcing your company to the world, receiving an endorsement from an influencer, or driving awareness to your crowdfunding campaign, press can be a great way to reach a targeted audience. In this event, we'll talk about strategies for obtaining press stories.

___________________________________________________


This Meetup will cover:

• What PR is and how it can help your business

• Strategies for connecting with journalists


• How to pitch your story, but more importantly, how to be a resource


• How to create your press plan

Panelists

• Josh Danoff, Founder at Union Square Donuts

Josh is a co-founder of Union Square Donuts. Before donuts he founded Culinary Cruisers with his brother and sister. They designed and built a cold storage chest on a bike and began selling kombucha (a fermented tea drink), on tap at local farmers markets. Shortly after, they began producing fresh fruit popsicles under the name Ocean Ave Pops. Prior to Culinary Cruisers and Union Square Donuts, Josh owned and operated a successful stonemasonry business in his hometown of Amherst, Massachusetts. He moved on to become an elementary school Special Education Instructor and has led creative writing workshops for incarcerated youth.

• Charlie McEnerney, Director of Communications at The Grommet 

Charles McEnerney is the Director of Communications at The Grommet. Charlie has worked in a variety of marketing roles over the past 25 years, including at HBO, Fast Company magazine, WGBH, MovieMaker magazine, the Seattle International Film Festival, and in film, audio, and music production. Charlie currently teaches several marketing courses at Emerson College in the Professional Studies program.


• Kate Weiler, Co-Founder at DRINKmaple

Kate Weiler is the Co-Founder and CEO of DRINKmaple which makes maple water, a natural hydration beverage. She is a passionate advocate for nutrition and holistic wellness and an Ironman triathlete. She holds a Master of Science in Nutrition from Northeastern University and is a Certified Holistic Health Coach from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition. She holds a Bachelor of Arts from Colby College. Kate is the author of Real Fit Kitchen published by Fair Winds Press in October of 2015.

Schedule

6- 6:30: Mingle

6:30-7:30: Discussion and Q&A

7:30-End: Mingle

Sponsors

THANK YOU to WeWork for hosting our events!
results.name: Keys to Getting Press

results.description:
Have you been tasked with adding video to your online courses, but need a guide to start? Are you making videos now but want to improve quality? This beginner-friendly session for faculty will give you the pointers you need to create effective video lectures. With just your laptop, you can make a wide range of engaging teaching media: 


• Video "talking head" lectures

• Videos with slides

• Newscast-style lectures

• Screencasts that allow you to demo technologies

• Live broadcasts Interactive video conferences with students 

We'll walk you through the free and low-cost technologies to make your own video lectures, even if all you've even done before is take cellphone camera photos. Come learn how to create videos that engage students, produce great learning outcomes, and look professional! A light dinner will be served. 

Cost: Full-Time Faculty and Designers: $35, Adjuncts: $20, CIC, ImpactHub, and Seeking Work: $15

Includes light dinner

Register Here


About the Instructor: 

 James Lacey

Associate Director, Online Education, Baystate College 

Because I've led two lives, I have a rather interesting background ..... 

In my First Life, I was a manager in high-technology industry. My roles and accomplishments include:


*Product manager for a product with $1B lifecycle revenue.

*Consultant to one of the world's premier industrial design laboratories.

*Strategic planner in the research phase of "fiber to the home," marketed today by Verizon as Fios.

*Leader in business process improvement, $10M annual savings.

*Trainer/developer/project manager for international product database.


I entered my Second Life -- Higher Education -- after the dot-com bubble burst, and have accepted a wide variety of faculty and administrative roles. So far, in my "second life," I have:


*Managed online programs: quality/development/operations/support. 

*Trained and mentored online faculty.

*Worked with undergraduate, master's, and doctoral students.

*Created online courses and piloted a Learning Management System. 

*Reviewed bestselling economics (Schiller) and interdisciplinary studies (Repko) texts.

*Provided consulting services for curriculum development and course design.


I have frequently been asked to assume leadership positions -- to take charge -- during my career in industry and higher education. I have an entrepreneurial approach and am known as a "go to guy," a person who is "smart and gets things done.

Register here!

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~

Did you ever imagine speaking could be fun?

Our last Meet-ups won rave reviews from first-time guests. They enjoyed the simple exercises and learned useful techniques for connecting with an audience.

Our meet-ups are fast-paced and entertaining. Nobody feels intimidated. Come experience it for yourself: You'll get to listen to prepared speeches and learn simple yet effective speaking tips.


You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We do have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk very briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meet-ups run. [They start promptly at 6:50, so please arrive by or before 6:45. results.description:
Medical marijuana continues to gain legal status in more and more states, and even recreational use has been legalized by Colorado and Washington. Opinions abound as to how, when, and by whom it should be used – and in the fracas it sometimes gets lost that this medicine is an herb, not a drug. And if you want to understand an herb, you talk to an herbalist!

Much of the cannabis on the black market is grown under forced and artificial conditions; like modern conventional tobacco, the plant is abused. Don’t support the exploitation of plants!

As is true of all herbs, cannabis has specific properties and effects which can be useful to those suffering from pain and discomfort. By understanding its actions in the idiom of traditional herbal medicine, we can learn to identify when its use is indicated for a particular person or problem – as well as when it should not be used, or when another herb would suit the situation better.

Medicinal use of cannabis is a polarizing subject. We are not a dispensary or caregiver; we do not prescribe, cultivate, sell, prepare, or administer cannabis. This class is intended to provide information and guidance on the appropriate use of the herb in the context of legal use. Please think responsibly.

Wednesday, October 28th, 2015
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description:
With half of us having a chronic disease, government being taken over by zombie conservatives, our infrastructure crumbling, foreign investors losing confidence in the dollar, and ongoing climate disasters and mass extinction, US collapse seems immanent and likely to take down the global economy with it.


The talk will explain how this crisis has been caused by mass indulgence in instincts that were essential for tribal survival, but have caused massive problems ever since tribes became cities. I’ll offer ways to save paradise Earth.

If you doubt that people screw up massively and often, consider the eight decades of gasoline with the known poison lead damaging kids’ brains and raising crime levels about 4 times the base level (for the profit of oil companies). How about the low fat craze of the last 4 decades that deprived us of healthy fats, loaded our diets with sugars and processed carbs, and caused the steady rise in obesity, diabetes, heart disease, cancer, and Alzheimer’s. And how about the USA’s many needless wars, and today’s many civil wars like the one that has destroyed Syria.

The fundamental causes of these ongoing disasters are not as simple as just greed and unregulated capitalism. Starting with some of the most obviously destructive instincts (think of the damage) and continuing with increasingly deep underlying causes, consider:

·  Hyper-conservatism kept a tribe safe through cautious consumption of resources, punishment of wrong doers, and fear of outsiders

·  Mythical beliefs, as religion, gave a budding empire unifying ideology to defend and fervently spread to “ignorant pagans”

·  Mindless conformity kept food and family safe and enabled leaders to recruit massive armies

·  Normalcy bias, denying the likelihood of a disaster, kept tribe from panicky overreaction to every serious danger facing them

·  Ostracism of nonconformists threatened their lives, so today the very few folks that finally figure out what drives us to disaster are ignored or opposed by their friends, struggle to find a group that values their revelations appropriately, and eventually give up

Other instincts and their modern consequences will be explained. One is food bingeing on the nutrients foragers struggled to get: carbs (sugar and starch), meat, fat, and salt, not leaves like kale.

To prevent collapse and move toward paradise Earth, the diverse progressive issue groups must unite with the Democratic Party, agree on values and policy, communicate more effectively, and exploit political and marketing techniques as the Republicans do. They must deal with:

·  Republican dirty tricks Dems must reveal and fight gerrymandering, voter suppression (excessive ID demands), buying up the media, lying profusely, and now hacking the voting machines

·  More than paragraphs Dems’ pamphlets and websites are little more than paragraphs and a few photos. To communicate much faster, the best writers find the deep structure of the information and present it using that structure, such as outlines, tables, timelines or diagrams, with lots of headings. Then readers can quickly skip stuff they know or don’t care about, and review later.

·  Liberal-Conservative agreement Focus on issues most pols agree on (not the extreme Right) such as improved education, infrastructure, health, sustainable economy, research subsidies

·  Unseat Right-wingers Effective communication through websites, pamphlets, and retail campaigning can threaten extremists’ jobs, and they know their job alternatives are limited

The US has hope for a much better future for our offspring, but don’t count on the predicted acceleration of technology in the Singularity. The most advanced technologies such as artificial general intelligence and biotech are being developed for military, big pharma, hospitals, distracting social media, and not for happy, healthy people and effective democracy.

Quick references will be handed out for continued study. A warning: if you truly understand humanities’ problems and solutions, your friends will probably ignore or reject your ideas out of mindless conformity.
results.name: Collapse USA: How human instincts ruin our health, government & paradise Earth

results.description:
Want to relax, doing Tai Chi and Taste many different kinds of authentic Sang Dong Dumplings?  Try our Combination of Tai Chi and Dumpling  Tasting


[   Tai Chi   ]   7-8pm

Following Sifu Huan, and doing the whole Yang Style Tai Chi form just like all the Chinese did in the park every morning in China. Huan is the 6th generation of Yang Style Tai Chi. He is also the author of the book "Seeing Beyond the Tai Chi Footprint" and Co-author of the University Textbook "Orientation and Mobility for Independent Living". You have seen his articles featured in the international Tai Chi Magazine. He studied under 3 Grandmasters from Yang family. Assistant Instructor Jin Wang then will help the beginners Class.


[  Dumpling Tasting  ]  8-9pm

After some exercise, we will be heading to an authentic San Dong dumpling restaurant (vegetarian options included) at Qingdao Garden (2382 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge) and try some real San Dong Dumplings.

San Dong is the famous birth place of the philosopher Confucius and the Chinese Dumpling. While we can’t meet with Confucius, we sure can enjoy some of the best dumplings this restaurant has to offer and learn how to use chopsticks the right way.

Fee: $10 for  Class ( Dumplings are not included in the $10, Everyone pay themselves for dumplings)

All ages welcome!

For more information, please check our website at


http://www.huanstaichi.com


Huan's Tai Chi, 7 Temple Street, Cambridge -- direct entrance into our studio inside the YWCA building near Central Square T Station)
results.how_to_find_us: 1st single door on right at YWCA building
results.name: A Chinese Experience: Tai Chi and Dumpling

results.description:
Medical practitioners have long identified stress as a root cause of many of our modern ailments, from high blood pressure and gastrointestinal problems to anxiety and depression.

This simple and powerful process can be learned in one session and requires an investment of 12-15 minutes a day. It has the potential to transform the life of anyone who is willing to incorporate it into their everyday life.

Created by yogi and humanitarian Sadhguru Vasudev, Isha Kriya is rooted in the timeless wisdom of the yogic sciences. Today, for most people, the work "yoga usually conjures up images of twisting the body and impossible postures. The physical aspect of Yoga is only one facet of this multi-dimensional science. Yoga is a technology to bring the body and mind to the peak of their capabilities, allowing one to live to the fullest. Daily practice of Isha Kriya offers:

              * Enhanced clarity

              * Improved health

              * Heightened focus and energy

              * Greater prosperity and a state of peacefulness and joy

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:


• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing 

• Accountability 

• Ideas and inspiration 

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do 

Or, you can be a fly on the wall.  No pressure at all.  Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

We try to keep the meetings about an hour long, or shorter.  Here's the way it works:

• 7:00pm Join the meeting here:  https://hangouts.google.com/call/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea.  It tends to work best with Chrome (rather than Internet Explorer or FireFox).

• Intros, and goal checking: 

• New Members:  Who are you?  What are you working on?  And what is it you hope to get out of attending these meetings?

• Existing Members:  What was something that went well in this past week?  Is there anything you need help with? (I'll record in Trello).  Last, if you set a goal last week, did you accomplish that goal? (I'll record in Trello).

• Check-Up on last week's Hot Seat:  Did last week's hot seat participant implement our advice?  And with what result? 

• Hot Seat:  One member goes into depth on what they've been working on, telling us where they need assistance, what resources have helped them to be successful, and what strategies have been valuable.

• Accountability:  For those who use this group to keep themselves accountable, speak now and we’ll ask you next week if you met your goals.  

• (Meeting Ends around 8pm) 

• Chat and Offer Assistance: The Hangout will remain open until everyone leaves.  You can stay as long as you want to meet new members and give Rick any feedback you may have on his business. 

Feedback

What's ONE thing that would have made this meeting better? Either let me know during the session, or you can keep it anonymous by filling out the survey here:  

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/KFNMRFX

<a href="https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/KFNMRFX"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  Join by clicking the link in the description.  Give it a shot before the meeting to make sure you can join without any problems.  Let me know if you're having trouble.

results.description:
Medical marijuana continues to gain legal status in more and more states, and even recreational use has been legalized by Colorado and Washington. Opinions abound as to how, when, and by whom it should be used – and in the fracas it sometimes gets lost that this medicine is an herb, not a drug. And if you want to understand an herb, you talk to an herbalist!

Much of the cannabis on the black market is grown under forced and artificial conditions; like modern conventional tobacco, the plant is abused. Don’t support the exploitation of plants!

As is true of all herbs, cannabis has specific properties and effects which can be useful to those suffering from pain and discomfort. By understanding its actions in the idiom of traditional herbal medicine, we can learn to identify when its use is indicated for a particular person or problem – as well as when it should not be used, or when another herb would suit the situation better.

Medicinal use of cannabis is a polarizing subject. We are not a dispensary or caregiver; we do not prescribe, cultivate, sell, prepare, or administer cannabis. This class is intended to provide information and guidance on the appropriate use of the herb in the context of legal use. Please think responsibly.

Wednesday, October 28th, 2015
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.
results.name: Cannabis as Herbal Medicine

results.description:
Attention: Sarah is not feeling well so will be with us in spirit.

Please join Brian for a healing journey through the heart of sound. Through dozens of singing bowls and overtone chanting I will take you to a point of deep stillness where healing happens! Mun Su Sah Buddhist Temple has the best vibes around and we are going to make the healing sounds necessary to take you on the journey you need. Requesting a $20 Donation.


Sound healing can change your life. That is why I do it. Oh the places you'll go! The more open you are to sound the deeper your journey will be. You will feel the vibration coursing through you, moving energy, filling you with the power behind the sound. If you've never done anything like this, you should give it a try. You'll be laying down on a yoga mat or a couple of comfy cushions with a blanket and just letting the sound wash over you. It's not called a sound bath for nothing. You'll be able to feel it remove stuck energy in your energy field and many say that it feels like a weight has been lifted! You might just come away feeling ten pounds lighter!

The sound itself is precise as it is pure. Harmonic overtones from chanting and singing bowls revitalize the immune system and support healthy cell function. When we hear the vibration of the single string, which is the fundamental sound of a note, we also hear many other notes which are known as overtones. Harmonic overtone chanting is the ability to create two or more notes simultaneously with the mouth and tongue - the fundamental note and one or more higher sounds of a different pitch. The relationship between the notes creates coherence and harmony. The acoustic power of overtone harmonics will resonate with you, taking you to a place of wholeness, happiness and health.
results.name: Tibetan Singing Bowl and Overtone Soundbath

results.description:
DON'T MISS OUT!

Let's gather at a local speakeasy (Saloon in Davis Sq) to discuss some not-so-easy challenges that STEM educators and students are being faced with nationwide. This is a fantastic opportunity to meet individuals from all walks of life, all of whom share a passion for promoting  science, tech, engineering, and math education. 

Just grab an old-fashioned from the bar, and let's chat about some NEW and exciting approaches to foster an appreciation and understanding of STEM subjects among students of all ages. 

This is the first official 'Meet Up', so please invite your friends and colleagues if they'd be interested. 

This MeetUp will be organized as part of a group effort. Please post specific ideas on this page (or email the group owner) so that we can maximize our opportunities to network. Any ideas regarding MeetUp facilitation and execution would be great. PLEASE RSVP if you plan on attending so I can coordinate with the venue. Please email me with any inquiries. 

We are looking forward to seeing you on October 28th! There will be NO FEE for this first event, but please let us know if you or an affiliate would like to sponsor a future event.
results.name: Scientists and STEM Educators: A "Speakeasy" Kick Off Event

Another monthly meetup for Unreal Engine developers. Come talk shop, have some drinks, and enjoy.

Due to scheduling conflicts with our host, we'll need to meet on a Wednesday this month. Sorry for the inconvenience. As always, there will be some swag, a little bit of news, and fun.


Two major UE4 releases from Boston developers are worth mentioning:
Albino Lullaby is a perfect October game, creepy psychological exploration with a compelling story to discover, and the team at The Molasses Flood's rogue-lite survival adventure title The Flame in the Flood is in early access. Both releases have received enormous acclaim and are worth every penny of your support.

results.description:
Most Wednesdays we gather for an open gaming night at the Panera in Porter Square. This event is open to anyone, and usually doesn't have any sort of pre-arranged agenda -- anything you can bring is fair game, provided you can get it done in three hours!

* Your gallant host almost always brings something to play, and takes requests if you get said request to him by Tuesday night at the latest. Behold the collection: http://www.bgg.cc/collection/user/CmdrOverbite?gallery=large&rankobjecttype=subtype&rankobjectid=1&columns=title%7Cstatus%7Cversion%7Crating%7Cbggrating%7Cplays%7Ccomment%7Ccommands&geekranks=%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09Board+Game+Rank%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09&own=1&objecttype=thing&ff=1&subtype=boardgame

* Due to logistical concerns and a desire to keep peace with the management (who have been notably chill thus far about a bunch of freeloading nerds taking up their table space), I have set a limit of twelve attendees on these events going forward. I doubt this will be much of an issue, given our typical attendance numbers.

* Because our events tend to be small, and the games we typically play tend to be long, if at all possible, please let us know if you plan to be more than a couple of minutes late so that we don't launch into something without you. Likewise, if you're planning on arriving more than a half-hour late, you should be aware that it may not be possible to include you in a game. You're welcome to come by and hang out but the chances are better than even that we'll be hip-deep in gaming goodness by the time you arrive.

* Please be respectful of our hosts; stay mindful of closing time and throw 'em some business if you're hungry.

* Have fun and roll high!
results.how_to_find_us: We usually meet on the lower level -- look for the games!
results.name: Wednesday Gaming In Porter Square

results.description:
Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.
results.how_to_find_us: Right off of exit 6 on 93 south, coming from Boston, TGI Friday's is on your right side at the first set of lights, across from the South Shore Plaza Mall
results.name: South Shore ASL meetup

results.description:
Elizabeth and Ben Anderson...


https://www.facebook.com/ElizabethAndBenAnderson
http://elizabethandbenanderson.bandcamp.com/

...a Scottish fiddle and cello duo, have been gaining an enthusiastic following in the Boston area and throughout New England. Blending Scottish tunes with lively rhythms and innovative harmonies, they create a sound rooted in tradition, inspired by the contemporary, and completely original. On stage, they captivate audiences with their ability to effortlessly communicate musical nuances as only siblings can. In the words of WGBH's Brian O'Donovan, "They have taken the influence of people like Alasdair Fraser and Natalie Haas and really made their own mark on... traditional music." Elizabeth studies at Berklee College of Music and Ben is a student at Westborough High School.

As we did at our Loring-Greenough concert series, admission is by free-will donation.
Suggested donation $10-15.

results.description:
In this FREE mini-workshop, you'll learn specific tools that you can use right away to master intimate connections that are meaningful and loving.  

Spend Wednesday night with a group of like-minded friends (old and new) exploring what it means to live a life filled with love! 

** This mini-workshop is a multi-Meetup event with Sex Positive New England. It will begin with an Introduction/Orientation for SPNE followed by this HAI mini-workshop.  For more information, go to: http://www.meetup.com/Sex-Positive-New-England/

If this feels scary to you and you've been holding yourself back, this workshop is for you! 

Discover what's in your way of having the most satisfying  relationships including effective communication, and great sex. 

This workshop will focus on our innate ability to open to a greater love inside ourselves - that can be shared with others: a skill that when learned and practiced, enhances all of our relationships.  Feeling deeply connected to yourself and your heart provides a deep sense of peace. 

You’ll learn specific tools that will:

• Enhance your ability to identify core wants, needs and desires 

• Cultivate communication for healthy relating

• Become more intimate with yourself and others - with ease! 

• Stay in a place of love when it’s most difficult

In this free mini-workshop, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with others through a variety of exercises designed to open your heart and support you in sharing authentically with one another.

Come and get a taste of what you’ve been craving in a totally safe, warm, loving and non-sexual environment.  Learn more about what the Human Awareness Institute has to offer.

Finding love and being in love every day is something I personally never dreamed was possible (only for 'others' and not for me!)  Well, I'm happy to say I was wrong and am really excited to share what I've learned with you.

Each event begins promptly at the scheduled time. There will be no admittance after the scheduled start time so as not to break the continuity of the workshop.  

We look forward to seeing you there!  Even if you've been to a mini-workshop before, please join us again!  There's no limit to how many you can attend!
results.name: Live Your Life Filled With Love - with Robyn Vogel and Kim Weeter

https://www.facebook.com/ElizabethAndBenAnderson
http://elizabethandbenanderson.bandcamp.com/

Elizabeth and Ben Anderson, a Celtic fiddle and cello duo, has been gaining an enthusiastic following in the Boston area and throughout New England. Blending Scottish tunes with lively rhythms and innovative harmonies, they create a sound rooted in tradition, inspired by the contemporary, and completely original. On stage, they captivate audiences with their ability to effortlessly communicate musical nuances as only siblings can. They recently opened for the Battlefield Band at the Burren in Somerville, in a concert which will be airing on Brian O’Donovan’s Celtic Sojourn on WGBH radio. They have performed at the Boston Celtic Music Festival, the Ossipee Music Festival, the Club Passim Campfire Festival, and in numerous solo concerts and restaurant and club performances.


Elizabeth is a Senior at Berklee College of Music and is a three-time New England Regional Junior Scottish Fiddle Champion, current second place holder in the New England Regional Open Scottish Fiddle Competition, and third-place holder in the 2014 US National Open Scottish Fiddle Championship. Ben is a student at Westborough High School and current second place holder in the New England Regional Junior Scottish Fiddle Competition and third place holder in the National Junior Scottish Fiddle Championship.

“They have taken the influence of people like Alasdair Fraser and Natalie Haas and really made their own mark on what they are doing in traditional music.”
--Brain O’Donovan, Host of WGBH Radio’s Celtic Sojourn

results.description:
(2015) dir Hou Hsiao-Hsien w/Shu Qi, Chen Chang [107 min; DCP]

IFFB: The AssassinSold Out!This event has sold out.

Back with his first film in 8 years, legendary Taiwanese director Hou Hsiao-hsien wowed this year’s Cannes Film Festival (where he won Best Director) with his awe-inspiring THE ASSASSIN – a wondrous take on the traditional wuxia film. The story is simple, if elusive – in 9th-century China, Nie Yinniang is a young woman who was abducted in childhood from a decorated general and raised by a nun who trained her in the martial arts. After 13 years of exile, she is returned to the land of her birth as an exceptional assassin, with orders to kill her betrothed husband-to-be. She must confront her parents, her memories, and her long-repressed feelings in a choice to sacrifice the man she loves or break forever with the sacred way of the righteous assassins. Rich with shimmering, breathing texture and punctuated by brief but unforgettable bursts of action, THE ASSASSIN is a martial arts film like none made before it.

"Enigmatic and often mesmerizing, super-saturated with color, drawn like a still plain ripped by brief, unexpected gusts of wind—The Assassin is one of the most flat-out beautiful movies of the last decade, and also one of the most puzzling. " - AV CLUB

Part of the Independent Film Festival's Fall Focus, The Assassin is like a Fall taste of the Independent Film Festival.  IFF members get reserved seating and a discount on tickets.

See you at the Movie,

John
results.how_to_find_us: Since this is a weeknight, we can gather before the film at Orinoco, Boston's Best South American, at 5:30 to discuss The IFF Fall Focus and the oeuvre of Hou Hsiao-Hsien
results.name: The Assassin - Special Premiere Screening

results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

results.description:
The Golden Chickpea in Brookline Village is hosting a breakfast on Thursdays for Moms and babies/toddlers. The little ones can play while we chat- there are plenty of toys. Hope to see some of you there!

http://www.thegoldenchickpeacenter.com

At The Golden Chickpea Center, we provide a warm and friendly atmosphere with emotional and social support in Brookline Village. Our main objective is to strengthen the initial emotional bond between families and their children in the community, particularly those who have no other family in the area.

In a cosmopolitan city such as Boston where young families come from many parts of the country and the world, due to education and professional opportunities, being far away from family is a common occurrence. Our center is a great alternative to fill this need.

We aim to be the premiere urban destination for cosmopolitan families with young children to socialize, have fun, and experience the richness of different cultures among us.

 Our Center is a welcoming place for families of all compositions and backgrounds where children and parents can learn, play and grow together creating shared experiences that last a lifetime... 


If you are one of those  families, join us,  you will feel at home!
results.name: Breakfast at The Golden Chickpea Center

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Suffragette is a moving drama that will empower all who are striving for equal rights in our own day and age. The stirring film, directed by BAFTA Award winner Sarah Gavron and written by Emmy Award winner Abi Morgan, is inspired by the early-20th-century campaign of the Suffragettes, who were activists for Women’s Suffrage – the right of women to vote.

The time is 1912. The U.K. is seeing an increased public presence of the Suffragettes, whose rallying cry is “Votes for Women!” Their efforts at resistance over the years have been passive, but as the women face increasingly aggressive police action, they engage in public acts of civil disobedience endangering property – but never human life. The epicenter of their national Women’s Social and Political Union (WSPU) is in London, where Maud Watts (played by Carey Mulligan) is a working-class wife and mother; she and husband Sonny (Ben Whishaw) toil at a laundry. Startled one day by a protest, Maud recognizes a co-worker, Violet Miller (Anne-Marie Duff), among the agitators. Initially unwilling to get involved in the Suffragette cause, Maud comes to realize that she must claim her dignity both at home and in her workplace …

https://youtu.be/Y4jBXQM7mIk
results.name: Suffragette   10-29 Thur.     Kendall Sq.  7 PM

results.description:
IMPORTANT! RSVP required: </a><a href="http://events.constantcontact.com/register/event?llr=eb4pbzaab&oeidk=a07ebkh3jj963b609b6">Click here!


The idea of “privacy” has undergone significant changes in the digital age, as has the idea of privacy “harm.” Fearful of British spying, influence and intervention, the founding fathers granted citizens significant protections in the Constitution. Now, the tables have turned: Concerns about what some see as a U.S. “dragnet” and unwarranted privacy intrusions have compelled other countries to revamp their own privacy protections. Legislation, both at home and abroad, hasn’t kept pace with technological developments, leaving some wondering if privacy as we know it is long dead.

With “cyberspace” increasingly seen as a new plane of warfare, how can we ensure the country’s networks are protected? Can policymakers and technological titans create a system nimble enough to capture threats while simultaneously protecting citizens’ right to privacy? What are the implications of US government surveillance for relationships with our allies, and our enemies?

Find out more here: http://worldboston.org/event-calendar/balancing-cybersecurity-and-privacy-in-the-digital-age/
results.how_to_find_us: We probably will be all throughout the audience, but I will be wearing a red dress shirt and black pants; you can reach me at (617)583-3781 if you need help finding where it is.
results.name: WorldBoston Event: Balancing Cybersecurity and Privacy

results.description:
Picking colors for a UX design project can be frustrating. Whether you need to adapt to an existing brand guideline, or pick a scheme for a new product, the color selection process can feel daunting. The options appear limitless. Adjusting one of the colors inevitably changes the balance. In addition, color preferences are subjective and it can be difficult to articulate the choices you made.

In this workshop, we will make balanced color palettes to answer specific design objectives, practice explaining the reasoning behind the decisions we made, and use physical paper swatches as an alternative to a digital process.


Who’s this workshop for?

This workshop is great for UX designers - beginners and advanced practitioners alike. It will also serve to improve the understanding of color as a powerful tool for engineers, graphic designers, and design thinkers of many professions.


Things you will learn:

• Why colors can mean different things to different audiences

• What to prepare before you begin color selection

• A step-by-step process for selecting colors that work together and support your goals

• Best practices for fixing or refining the color palette


Key takeaways:

• Make solid color decisions quickly

• Learn a repeatable, goal-oriented process to “solve” the colors for any project

• Build confidence to support and articulate your decisions

• A reasoned approach to color choices

• Tips & tricks for refining color choices

---------------------------------------

UX East is organized by DockYard

DockYard is a cross-platform interface design and development company based in Boston, MA. We’re hired to design, development, and project manage for clients of all sizes making impact in both public and private sectors.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter 294 Washington St., smile to the security guard (let them know you're heading to DockYard), take elevator to 11th floor and take a right!
results.name: Color for UX Design Workshop

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

The French Cultural Center is hosting a free ($5.00 donation suggestion) French film, "Après Mai" (2012) [Something in the Air].

Even though this is a free event, a reservation is required.


You may register online at 

http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/events/scheduled-events/cine-club-de-lalliance-apres-mai/

or via phone at[masked]-0400.


When you register online there is a confusing message stating that members will be asked to show Member Card at the door.  This message does not apply to free events.  Just to reconfirm, this is a public and free event, however registration is required. 

This is a relatively small venue which seats approximately 70 people.  Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

The film starts at 6:30 pm, however the meeting time for this event is set for 6:00 pm in the reading room.  The film will be presented in the adjacent room, the ballroom.  The plan is to gather and meet-up in the reading room and then go to the film viewing room at 6:30 pm.

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

** *

About the Film


Set in the aftermath of the cultural and political upheavals of May '68, this film tells the story of a group of young Europeans exploring their artistic, romantic and political awakening. The film is also an ode to a thrilling, evanescent moment in history when young people could feel revolution just within their grasp. Actress Lola Créton won the Revelation César for this film while director Olivier Assayas won for Best Screenplay at the Venice Film Festival.

This 2012, 122-minute film will be presented in its original French version, with English subtitles.

The screening will conclude with an open discussion led by our in-house film expert, Barbara Bouquegneau.


To view trailers,

•  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1846472/ 

• https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-m27BchNk1o


Directions and Parking Information


• Getting here via public transportation (MBTA)Green Line

Get off at Arlington station. Walk north along Arlington Street toward the Charles River. Turn left onto the third street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, at the opposite corner on the right.

Via the Orange Line or Commuter Rail

Get off either train at Back Bay Station. Walk north along Clarendon Street toward the Charles River. Turn right onto the fifth street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, on the left corner.

• Parking

Parking is available at the Boston Common Parking Garage (located at Zero Charles St, below the Boston Common Park) on Saturdays all day and on week days after 4pm for $10. Buy your discounted ticket with our receptionist.

http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/about-us/directions-hours/
results.how_to_find_us: in the reading room at 6pm
results.name: French Film Screening - "Après Mai" (2012)  [Something in the Air]

results.description:
Analytics.Club's Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer

About the Event:

Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer networking event is conducted every last Thursday of the month. This event will primarily focus on building networks to initiate good conversations on data science across different venues around the town.

The monthly event will be Networking only mixer(Just plain and simple networking with no long sales pitch or knowledge sessions) envisioned to keep local data science professionals connected. You will use the opportunity to exchange contact information, seek opportunities, and connect with fellow data science professionals and build deeper connected networks.

Goal: We hope you at least make 2 new contacts / event & spread the word on event so more and more data science professionals could leverage the opportunity to build their personal network.

When: Last Thursday of the Month

Time: 6:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

Location: Local Bar / Cafe  (hopefully a new exploration every month). Venue will be our participating members choice and will be finalized one week prior to the event every month. 

* Please provide a bar/cafe recommendation in the comment section and vote yes if you agree *

Refreshments/Drinks: Buy Your Own Drink/Meal

(We appreciate sponsor pitching in on drinks/refreshments to support a great cause)

Agenda:

0. Put name tag with following initials in circle (optional, for effective networking):

a. (B) for Business Background 

b. (C) for Coding Background 

c. (S) for Statistician Background 

d. (T) for Technology Background 

e. (M) for Math / Modeling Background

1. Open networking (20min)

2. Job / Employee seekers pitch (20min)

Quick pitch (90secs each) from Job seekers or recruiters

3. Product /Project pitch session (20min)

Quick pitch(2min each) from data enthusiast who wants to share among fellow data science professionals.

4. Open networking (60min)

FAQ:

1. Can I be the event host/organizer for an evening?

Yes. We do appreciate our community members to take charge and help build a great networking event. Please make your interest known to us in comment section.

2. Can my company sponsor for the drinks/refreshments? What do they get?

Yes. Besides great karma points for helping build a strong data science community, the company will also get face time with brightest data science professionals for brand recognition. You also get an opportunity for a 90 sec pitch time about the company & job openings.

3. Will event still happen even if there are no sponsors?

Yes. As long as there is a mutually agreed bar/cafe for the evening the event is a GO. Attendees will buy their own drinks/refreshments.

4. Could we volunteer our office space for the networking?

Yes, one of the bigger objective for the event is to introduce various innovation/discussion hubs to data science community.

5. What are the possible scenarios in which event can be cancelled?

Public Holidays, Bad Weather, Lack of interest or No venue.

6. I still have questions. How can I get them answered?

Best way is to put them in comment section, so that even our members can pitch in. You are welcome to email us as well at info[at]analytics[dot]club
results.name: Data Analytics.Club Monthly Mixer

NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM brings together business-owners, coaches, and service-providers, for enlightened discussions. Each participant, expert in his own field, benefits from the others’ perspectives.

It's been called "Innovation Speed-dating" and has benefited dozens of businesses so far.


This WEEK, we're honored to have public speaking expert Kit Pang deliver a mini-workshop demonstrating the value of having a memorable delivery for your business' core message.  Kit makes speaking- and listening- skills your strength. 

We are also honored to have Ms. Betsy Cowan, from the City of Boston's Office of Business Development join us, promoting the On-site Technical Assistance  Program. 

See more details in the agenda below. 

--

GETTING HERE

Join us at Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--

QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?


- Contact Ian: [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign or anyone wearing a green Gain Street T-shirt in the Venture Cafe before our event

--


AGENDA

5 pm - Optional networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org

6 pm - FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum

Follow signs to the Cozumel Room on the 5th floor.

Need help getting here? Contact [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

1. Intros

2. Bring your hardest problems and collaborate with other entrepreneurs and experts in a group setting

3. Owners and Experts break into groups for an idea sharing round. 

- Public Speaking workshop by Kit Pang.

Bio: Kit Pang is a public speaking consultant and trainer.  He loves to work with entrepreneurs to hone their storytelling skills while offering engaging and insightful experiences through communication seminars for organizations.  Currently, he is the President of the Federal Toastmaster Club of Boston and a member of the Advanced Access Toastmaster Club in Brookline.  Kit volunteers as a TEDx Speaker Coach and as a founder of BostonSpeaks, a Meetup group dedicated to connecting speakers in Boston.  Kit has won numerous awards in public speaking and actively participates in story slams and poetry slams throughout Boston.

- Innovation Speed Dating, where we’ll match coaches to business owners.

results.description:
Once again, we're trying a different kind of event! Well, technically, two events. But most people will probably feel more comfortable at one or the other. ;)

We're having a Thursday Night Dinner for our members and guests in their 20's, 30's, and 40's for a night of socializing and dining at Jamie's Grille in Braintree as we gather together to break bread on this Fall Evening.  Jamie's, which is located at the intersection of Grove and Columbian Streets less than 1/2 mile from Weymouth, recently renovated the restaurant to open up the bar area.  I don't think they did much to the dining room side of the restaurant which is most likely where we'll be seated.  Let's have a fun evening dining with other members and guests in their 20's, 30's, and 40's.  Please be advised we may need to wait a few minutes to be seated but they will most likely have our table ready right on time.

Tonight I will be using a BOGO Dinner Coupon so the least expensive meal will be taken off the bill and we will all enjoy a savings of $1-2pp, depending on the number of attendees.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

20s, 30s and 40s Thursday Night Dinner Social!

Thursday, October 29th @ 6:30pm

Jamie's Grill & Pub

63 Columbian Street

Braintree, MA 02184

[masked]

Website: www.jamiespub.com

Meeting Location: Outside the Front Door (which is not right off the parking lot) or Our Table(s) after we are seated.  The reservation is in my name only.

Hosts/Organizer: Angela  (A Co-Host would be awesome!)

Min/Max: Minimum of 4 people 72 hours prior to the event.  Maximum of 14 people which has since been lowered to 6 people.

Guests: Yes, one age appropriate adult per member.

Price Range: Most meals are in the $10-$25 range.

Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy for over eight years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

Event Fees: Event fees are $2pp.  These are collected towards the end of the event, generally when the bill arrives.

2015 Annual Membership: Annual Membership dues for 2015 are $5.00 per year.  These are collected towards the end of the event, generally when the bill arrives.

RSVP Deadline: Thursday, October 29th @ Noon  ~ Any changes may not be seen after that time and no new RSVPs will be allowed less than 2 hours prior to the event as the restaurant wants a final count early in the day.

Snow/Inclement Weather Date: None.  Unlikely to need to reschedule but if we do we will update here.  My hope is that we can host 2 of these "YMO" (20s/30s/40s) events per year so we can get to know each other, increase our member numbers, and not feel like we are in the minority at most of the SSDOMG events since the age range in our Group skews "older."  ("Older" meaning 40+ or 50++.  Remember, I started this group when I was 28 and was - and still am - one of the youngest members!)

No-Show Policy: We have updated and greatly simplified our no-show policy. People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.

Failure to do the above may result in your removal from the group at the Group Organizer's discretion.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Parking: Free and ample parking in lot.

Directions Overview: Located at the intersection of Columbian, Grove, and West Streets in Braintree on the Weymouth line.

Event is closed.

Why mess with a winning formula, right?

Let's get together for a Meet and Greet at Viale, a new Mediterranean-inspired restaurant in Central Square, Cambridge followed by an optional dinner.

We'll start the evening with a Meet & Greet in the bar area of the restaurant. The RSVP fee includes tasting portions from 4 wines with $1 oysters, assorted hors d'oeuvres and other nibbles, tax and tip included. Relaxed, informal wine and food tasting -- novice or expert, you will enjoy it. 

Afterwards about 8:30 PM, those who are interested can join us for a sit-down dinner. NOTE: $$ for dinner is NOT included in RSVP; the menu is very eclectic, covering several price points, so the choice is up to you. I ate there recently and expect the total tab to come to $25 (meet&greet) + $25 = $50 each.

COST

PRICE: $25 payable with your RSVP

Usual BostonWine refund policy applies. I will offer a full refund up to 24-hours prior to the event. Space is limited, so please don't RSVP unless you know that you can attend. RSVP fee is for Meet and Greet only--dinner is optional and extra cost.

POLICIES

Limited to 30 total including +1s. I may promote newbies up from wait list. Everyone must be a member of BostonWine and pay in advance. RSVP early, but please don't RSVP unless you're sure that you can make it.

NOTE: As part of the RSVP process you will be asked to accept the group's Policies and Disclaimer (use a new web browser window to see the About Us section of our group's home page). You must answer "Yes" in this event's RSVP to attend. (Note, apparently some versions of the Meetup mobile app don't display this question -- in that case, RSVP with your phone and then use a web browser later on to update your RSVP). 

WHAT TO BRING 

Yourself! Food and wine will be provided.

WHERE


Viale
502 Massachusetts Ave.
Cambridge, MA 02139
<a>http://www.</a>vialecambridge.com/

T: Red line, Central Square

Parking: Green Street Garage

Note about venue. Viale is a chic, urban restaurant at the MIT end of Central Square. Check it out at URL above. As with many urban neighborhoods, however, the square has its share of street people and rough edges, so put on your best city persona. I DO feel it is safe, however, and commute through it every day. Email me with questions.

ABOUT

Viale serves ingredient-driven, Mediterranean-inspired food in a warm and casual environment. The rotating menu showcases seasonal pasta dishes, appetizers, and entrees; simple grilled pizzas, and meats perfectly charred on a wood-fired grill. All major ingredients are locally sourced. The wine list features the vintages of small organic and biodynamic growers.

This promises to be a fun event. I look forward to seeing you!

-Jim

Start the night from 6:45-7:15 with networking.  Also, because we have a private space for our speaker we are required to get food and a drink (non-alcoholic is fine). 


Topic: Grow Your Business

What does success look like for you in your business? What’s it take to get there? How do you measure it? And how do you celebrate it? Success starts with you. It is created from vision, clarity, purpose and passion. And yet, we often get in our own way and become our own worst enemies – on an individual, as well as organizational level. Coaching helps you identify what is sabotaging you, eliminates your fear, gets you unstuck and moves you forward toward your goals. 

Join us on Thursday October 29th to learn from Professional coach, Laura Miolla (www.moxielifecoach.com)­, who will highlight the differences between coaching and therapy, outline the formula for professional success and share success stories from previous clients … so that you can take away some useful tips for YOUR business.

results.description:
<We will sing inspiring songs, come together in community, and let the sound in each of us be heard.If you're inspired by music, by community, by authentic expression... you'll want to join us!>

                                                           Design by Sarah May Gubkin


Let your heart sing!
Do you love to sing, but…?
Do you yearn to step into fuller expression? To be heard? To hear yourself? In a circle tradition, and with love and acceptance, we will sing songs of inspiration and gently embrace and allow our voices to express from within. It doesn’t matter how you sound, because this is about:
• the energy that flows (and doesn’t care if we’re in tune),
• opening a door to your heart and giving it wings to express,
• bringing the wisdom of many song traditions into our daily lives, and
• the power of supportive community.
In a SpiritSong circle, we learn to listen deeply and open to the beautiful spaces within, and we are heard without judgment. We cultivate authentic expression. We share in the healing joy of sound!

Our facilitator for this Evening

Carolyn Sprague, is a certified SpiritSong Facilitator.  Trained by SpiritSong originator, Shawna Carol, Carolyn has a passion for song, for coming together in sacred gatherings, for uniting our voices. She listens deeply and leads gently, making even the most reluctant voices feel welcome, often using call and response techniques that make it easy to chime right in.

You are warmly invited to join us at our monthly drop-in Inspiring Life: SpiritSong evening,  in Stow, MA.


Links 

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies: 
  *  What is a Heartbeat Salon?  
  *  Where are Heartbeat Salons  
  *  Guidelines for Attending a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Hosts: 
  * How to Host a Heartbeat Salon . 
  * Topics to Offer at a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Presenters: 
  * How to Present at a Heartbeat Salon .

Your Suggestions: 
  * Give Us Your Ideas (topics, locations, etc) .


I participated in a women's song circle years ago. It really inspired me, to have all those voices sounding as one, voicing the words of inspired musicians. I have yearned to create a local song circle ever since that time. Since my musical abilities are not aligned with leading a song circle, I just kept hoping someone would come along to lead. Getting to know Carolyn over time I became aware of her extraordinary qualities as a song leader. Eventually, one day, I asked, would you like to lead a song circle? I'll organize. We can hold it here. And, voila... we set up our first SpiritSong Circle here in Stow. We started slow, just trusted loved ones, and now we're ready to offer this wonderful experience to a wider audience! hooray! - MariePatrice

Does this event inspire you?  If you're inspired by Personal growth, Transformation, Healing, Awakening, Spirituality, Community, Nature and Ecology you'll want to check out our other
                                              INSPIRING LIFE events
                                      www.tinyURL.com/InspiringLife contact
[masked],[masked]
or look for our events right here on the
Personal Growth Network.

What inspires you? How can we support you in creating your inspiring life?
