results.description:
{Do you seek greater inner peace?  Peacemakers is a group that helps you look at what "peace" means to you and helps you find how to create more peace in your life.}


Our Topic This Evening Will ....

... ...provides you an opportunity to let go of tension, upsets, and judgments so that you can experience more well-being.

Many of us have accepted living with tensions in our bodies, with upsets spoiling our mood at unexpected times, with prejudices that sometimes surprise us, and with judgments sneaking in. 

There is an alternative. We can live in a consciousness that can be called many things. We call it peace. It can also be called “well-being” or “living in the zone” or “grace” or "acceptance". It is not passive or inactive, but vital and alive. It is a consciousness in which we see clearly; we accept what is present; we know what is possible; and we see how to cooperate with what is present in a positive way. It is the way we are functioning when we are at our best making a positive contribution. We enrich our individual lives, our social situations and the world at large. The way it manifests in each of us may be quite different because we are unique beings. When you are living in this consciousness, what would you call it?

During this meeting, we will move into this consciousness that we call peace. It is always present within us -- no matter what else is going on inside us or outside us in the world. As we practice recognizing our inner core of peace, we become increasingly able to choose to live in that consciousness of inner peace, even at difficult times of our lives. 

We will look at where we unconsciously practice "against-ness", and learn to let go of that against-ness. We then work better with reality and with the people who surround us. As we let go of "against-ness", we also let go of the upset feelings, prejudices, judgments, tenseness, etc. This is a process that occurs naturally without any effort on our part. As we let go of our “against-ness”, this consciousness naturally shows up.

This work is grounded in the realization that peace must start with the individual. One cannot fight for peace. If we are going to be a conduit for this consciousness, we must start with ourselves and be in peace. This consciousness is defined as the absence of against-ness. If we can be in peace without being against others or ourselves or situations and encourage others to do the same, then we can be a conduit for this consciousness into the world. 

In this meeting, we are collectively planting seeds of peace for ourselves, New England, the world and more. The extent of this work is clearly profound and yet a mystery to us.

This meeting is sponsored by the Institute for Individual and World Peace (IIWP, http://www.iiwp.org/).


To Prepare ....

1) When do you feel "against-ness"? 
2) What are the physical signs of your against-ness? (e.g., tightness in throat)  
3) How could you be more effective if you were in peace even when bad things happened?

Our Leader This Evening

https://fbcdn-profile-a.akamaihd.net/hprofile-ak-prn2/v/t1.0-1/c39.0.160.160/p160x160/537349_10152034344599510_1494662630_n.jpg?oh=e6044f0c169d6d3bcd9bce21fb142bbc&oe=5615B058&__gda__=1446013507_b7d9a5381ee0960560099851af0e879a

David Jenkins aspires to live his life more and more in peace. He considers himself a student of living the four principles of peace in his life. This is his highest priority. He is overjoyed to have been involved with the Peacemaker Project for several years. It expands peace in a quiet, loving way, one person at a time.


Emily Page delights in finding joy with others and as an inner process one moment at a time.She's been assisting with Boston Area PeaceMaker Meetings because the simple tools shared go so deep, work so fast and foster such harmony between participants, one session after another.

results.description:
Ongoing class in 18th century Scottish Broadsword and Smallsword.

The Broadsword is the archetypal weapon of the Highlander swordsman - a broad-bladed cutting and thrusting weapon. It has a basket hilt to protect the hand and wielded single-handed.

The Smallsword is the courtly weapon of the Scottish warrior class. An elegant thrusting weapon it teaches the fighter to use the thrust and make small parries. The smallsword is the immediate predecessor to modern epee.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.

All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Scottish Smallsword & Broadsword

results.description:
I hope you’ve all donned your Halloween-themed Twitter names and inexplicably begun using the word “spoopy,” because it’s that time again: BostonJS.

Also it is nearly Halloween, and your host loves him some Halloween. Should you plan to attend our next meetup in costume? Absolutely you should—’tis the season, after all, and our highly subjective panel of one judge (me) will be awarding the JavaScripter with the best costume an official Bocoup t-shirt. 

If you’re strapped for last-minute costume ideas, fear not—we here at BostonJS Meetup Inc. have you covered:

• PhantomJS, the heeeeadless broooowser
• Android 2.3, the browser that would not die
• CSS, by always standing just a little bit off from where you’re supposed to be standing
• A future BostonJS speaker, by applying to speak at BostonJS

Will your host for the evening be in costume? You’d better believe it. Will I also be wearing a second, more whimsical costume on top of my usual “person capable of hosting a JavaScript meetup” costume? Yes—also yes.

But let us not get so wrapped up in costumes, candy, and stickers that we lose sight of the true meaning of the BostonJS holiday: we’ve got some amazing talks lined up for this month:

Vorlon.Js - Debugging in a Multidevice World
James Sturtevant

Wouldn't it be nice to never again have to ask the question, "What browser are you using"? With Vorlon.JS, an open source, platform agnostic tool, your ability to be a multidevice debugging master becomes a reality. In this interactive talk you will learn how to deploy, use and run Vorlon.js. See how it can help you remotely debug and test your JavaScript on multiple devices. Because after all, it’s a multidevice world, and development requires a multidevice debugging tool. 

Live Font Interpolation on the Web
Andrew Johnson


Responsive web design can be tricky, especially with regards to typography. It’s easy enough to adapt the type styles we can control—`font-size`, `font-weight`, `line-height` and so on—to a wide range of viewports. Fonts themselves are pretty inflexible, though—we’re stuck loading every possible weight and style we could potentially need, across all our breakpoints. This talk will discuss the potential for new level of control and flexibility with our typefaces: live font interpolation, a method of allowing a font itself to adapt to its surrounding context.


Our sponsors for the evening will be Ryan Florence and Michael Jackson—co-authors of React Router and full-time software trainers at React.js Training. They’re bringing both of their React.js workshops to Boston, and they've provided a discounted ticket price to members of our group:


• React Fundamentals, October 22nd-23rd (in 9 days!) 

• Advanced React, November 11th-12th

There's probably not a faster way to get you and your team up to speed on React and getting the most out of it than by learning from these two. Out of hundreds of attendees surveyed, 100% say they would recommend the training to a friend—and that’s all the percents there are.

We hope to see you all there!
results.name: BostonJS: The `.call()` is Coming from Inside the Function

results.description:
Alright friends! Back to back sound healing. Come to Mun Su Sah Temple in Wakefield tomorrow for a hallowed sound healing from 8:30pm-9:45pm. A lady tonight asked if I was singing while I was playing the bowls because she couldn't tell. That's the art, to merge with the sound so not even I am able to tell which is which!

Please join me for a hallowed healing journey through the heart of sound. Through my singing bowls and overtone chanting, I will take you to a point of deep stillness where healing happens! Mun Su Sah Buddhist Temple at 231 Salem St. in Wakefield has the best vibes around I am going to make the healing sounds necessary to take you on the trip you need. Requesting a $20 Donation.

Sound healing can change your life. That is why I do it. Oh the places you'll go! The more open you are to sound the deeper your journey will be. You will feel the vibration coursing through you, moving energy, filling you with the power behind the sound. If you've never done anything like this, you should give it a try. You'll be laying down on a yoga mat or a couple of comfy cushions with a blanket and just letting the sound wash over you. It's not called a sound bath for nothing. You'll be able to feel it remove stuck energy in your energy field and many say that it feels like a weight has been lifted! You might just come away feeling ten pounds lighter!

The sound itself is precise as it is pure. Harmonic overtones from chanting and singing bowls revitalize the immune system and support healthy cell function. When we hear the vibration of the single string, which is the fundamental sound of a note, we also hear many other notes which are known as overtones. Harmonic overtone chanting is the ability to create two or more notes simultaneously with the mouth and tongue - the fundamental note and one or more higher sounds of a different pitch. The relationship between the notes creates coherence and harmony. The acoustic power of overtone harmonics will resonate with you, taking you to a place of wholeness, happiness and health.

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

From the Brighton Police Station to Oak Square YMCA, participating Brighton businesses will display a sign 'Welcome Trick or Treaters!' Families with children are welcome to join the fun for a safe and fun filled Trick or Treating route. Pizza party following at the Oak Square YMCA @ 5:00pm. District 14 Boston Police patrol officers and student volunteers from Boston College will once again be on-hand to ensure the safety of the youngsters while crossing the street. District 14 Police Captain Jim Hussey suggests to parents and guardians the best way to ensure the safety of their children is to accompany them while trick-or-treating. The Halloween route begins at the District 14 Police Station on Washington Street and continues down into Oak Square ending with a Halloween pizza party at the Oak Square YMCA, at 615 Washington St., at 5 p.m.
results.name: The 20th Annual Brighton Business Trick or Treat

results.description:
Be sure as introduction to ask who you are next to what other languages they speak and where they are from!

The area where we meet is quiet and there is no pressure to order food.

 I want you to see this incredible conversation from the last Polyglot meetup most people understood each other, need I say more!!?

http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Cultural-Nomads/events/224875977/

PLEASE MIX & MINGLE, change seats do not get stuck at tables. When (if) you get up to go get the food, please try finding a new seat when you return, the purpose of this event is to meet as many people as possible not get stuck in one place.     
  
I (host) want you to specify your heritage or international travel experience and I am sure you will have plenty of opportunities to speak with others about it-- !! All kinds of memories or shared experiences, family, and heritage. 
  NOTE also there are ways of expressing yourselves using the vocabulary of your foreign language that have no easy translation to English & that is also a topic for us.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet and Greet at the lower bar at the hightop tables, any prob ask reception for the Social Fun Meetup. People will trickle in do not expect there to be a group right away. Host Duncan will be late

Want to give your Halloween costume a dry run before the big day?  What better place than Lowell Makes, where you can make those last minute tweaks to get all the details just right?  


Then you'll be happy to learn that Lowell Makes is having our Halloween Party onOctober 30th, the night before Halloween.  So come join us for fun, food, music on All Hallows' Eve Eve. 


We encourage you to bring guests, and ask for either a pot-luck dish, or a "tool-luck" contribution (any small hand tool in good condition).
results.name: Monster Makers Halloween Party

results.description:
Do you play games? This is such a loaded question, because who doesn’t like to play games and what exactly is meant by games? Mind games? Tabletop? Video? How about yes to everything?
So how about we get together and think about playing games intentionally? If you want to know what that means, unfortunately, we can’t answer that question for you. What we can do is ask you to bring your favorite game or a game you would like to play, with the caveat that it has to make the world a better place. In this meetup, we will ask you to bring a game of your choice and to be prepared to engage in a conversation as to why you think your game will help move us towards liberation. We don't expect this conversation to be simple, understandable or easy. We are hopeful that we can generate a new tactic of organizing and participating in our society. The first hour we will discuss our games and the second hour, we are going to play them!!!

This is the first of a 3 day program.
results.name: Gaming and Community Building

When their peaceful town is ravaged by a zombie invasion, they’ll fight for the badge of a lifetime and put their scouting skills to the test to save mankind from the undead.

Let's meetup and check this out! But before we go, let's get some food and BEER! 6:15PM: Meet at the Rockbottom (115 Stuart St)
7:30PM Meet in lobby of theater.
8:00PM MOVIE!
9:30PM After movie drinks to discuss movie. And have drinks.

I will base reservations at Rockbottom based on RSVPs by noon the day before.

RED BAND TRAILER (NSFW!)

results.name: Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse

results.description:
Film: "We Are Egypt" Going beyond the headlines, this story—filmed in the fourteen months leading up to the Revolution— highlights the years of mounting resentment against the ruling regime. Filmmaker Lillie Paquette follows key opposition figures and young democracy activists as they struggle against extraordinary odds to remove an uncompromising US-backed authoritarian regime determined to stay in power. Screening followed by a reception and open discussion with the filmmaker. Event is free and open to the public.

Event link: https://centerforarabicculture.wordpress.com/2015/09/24/october-film-screening/
results.name: October Film Screening at Center for Arabic Culture: "We Are Egypt"

results.description:
A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  


_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantric Intimacy (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Speed Dating as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.

Relax on a Friday night:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate!


Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous:  Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]
results.name: NOHO, MA Intimate Puja Circle - SOLD OUT

Kip Moore Wild Ones Tour
Kip Moore, one of country music’s brightest rising stars, will release his highly anticipated sophomore album, WILD ONES on Friday, August 21st. Moore, who was once compared to a ‘hillbilly Springsteen’ by noted journalist Robert Oermann, has created a super-sized record inspired by the grit, grind and glamour of his live shows. Kip wrote each track on WILD ONES and delivers honest and deeply personal lyrics in a gravelly voice weathered by life’s detours and disappointments and strengthened by his dreams and unyielding determination.

results.description:
Please join  Bob from Laurie's 909 and the Red Sox Natives for a live music performance by the Amsterdam's Waiting at Laurie's 909 on Friday, October 30 7:00pm. Enjoy this acoustic trio perform covers of today, the 90's and others.

For more information on the band go to their face book page.

We will be gathering at the "Nickel" Bar at Laurie's.

There is no cover.

Stay for appetizers, dinner, cocktails and/or late night live music.

Full menu is available until 9:30pm. Late night menu is available afterward. If you have a group of people that want a table reservation for dinner please call Laurie's at[masked] and make a reservation. For information on Laurie's 909 and the menu go to www.lauries909.com.   .

If this will be your first time meeting the Red Sox Natives Crew please check out the photos of those who RSVP Yes so you can find the group.

Please remember to maintain your own tab or pay as you order and tip your servers. However, if you sit at a group table a group bill may be provided so please communicate with your server when ordering. Credit Cards may be held by the servers at Laurie's.

Laurie's 909 is one of Wakefield's newest restaurant and Bar with live entertainment several nights per week and many special E Mail list promotions. Laurie's is located at the Wakefield Commuter Rail Train Station in Wakefield. The Reading and Haverhill Commuter Rail trains stop at Laurie's. Laurie's is easily accessible within 10 minutes from Routes 128, 93, 28 and 1. Free parking is available in two lots on Tuttle Street, in the Church parking lot if there are no activities there, and on street after 5:30pm. Check out the MBTA or Hop Stop for additional public transit options including the less reliable/frequent 136 and 137 bus lines.

Check out the "Penny Lane" and "Nickel" Bars, the 9:09 and Beatles references.

More information at http://www.lauries909.com

See you there!
results.name: Amsterdam's Waiting at Laurie's 909

results.description:
MOVIE  / GENRE: Documentary/Politics/Conspiracy

Gold and Bronze Memberships entitle you to attend great events like this one! Please visit our Membership Levels Page to become a Bronze or Gold Member.

From Wikipedia:
Who Killed the Electric Car? is a 2006 documentary film that explores the creation, limited commercialization, and subsequent destruction of the battery electric vehicle in the United States, specifically the General Motors EV1 of the mid-1990s. The film explores the roles of automobile manufacturers, the oil industry, the U.S. government, the California government, batteries, hydrogen vehicles, and consumers in limiting the development and adoption of this technology.

After a premiere at the Sundance Film Festival, it was released theatrically by Sony Pictures Classics in June, 2006 and then on DVD by Sony Pictures Home Entertainment on November 14, 2006.

During an interview with CBS News, director Chris Paine announced that he had started a new documentary about electric cars with a working title of Who Saved the Electric Car?, later renamed Revenge of the Electric Car, which had its world premiere at the 2011 Tribeca Film Festival on Earth Day, April 22, 2011.  ( Wikipedia link)
The requisite Membership Level for this event is Bronze or above, and must be paid or acquired before you RSVP. DO NOT RSVP BEFORE PAYING (Click Here).
results.name: WHO KILLED THE ELECTRIC CAR?  A documentary movie by Chris Paine

results.description:
Boston Frisbee Halloween party!!!

Snacks! Mini Games! Capri Sun! GLORIOUS PRIZES! 1996 Little League Trophies that We Bought at the Goodwill! Boston Frisbee Halloween party has it all!

We'll be playing our regular games but with EVEN MORE FUN THAN USUAL! We'll have loads of treats and a bunch of goofy sideline games and contests. Come in costume for the costume contest! And of course, start brainstorming silly points for the competitive silly game. See you there!!!

As always remember to:

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. (Maybe bring a dark and light ghost costume?)

Arrive on time

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is a two-minute walk from Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Boston Frisbee Annual Spooktacular Halloween Party!!!!! @ Russell Field

results.description:
Hello to all the energy and intimacy explorers.  I am so excited to announce our next meetup! 

What would your life be like if you could experience every aspect of your private life and your work life from a state of ecstatic embodied pleasure?  Especially in the midst of stresses and uncertainties of life, when most of us have a hard time just staying in the body due to past trauma, or ongoing life challenges? Did you know you can train your brain to be in a pleasure state at will and almost instantly?

I have recently returned from presenting at a Canadian Energy Psychology Conference on Neurobiology of Embodied Pleasure.  Those who came to my session hailed it as a highlight of their conference experience. They told me that everything they learned was new and leading edge, something they did not know or experienced before..  So, make sure you don't miss this opportunity as I offer an encore presentation to the energy explorers  of this meetup.  

You can register at  http://www.meetup.com/Exploring-Energy-Intimacy/events/226156160/

The neurochemistry of pleasure has always been one of the brain's greatest mysteries -- difficult to define, and equally difficult to miss when it happens.  Thanks to increasing neuroimaging technology, we have ideas of where certain responses live in our brains.

Everyone is welcome to this energy  play-shop as you will journey directly into the experience of your own brain. You will have a rare opportunity to explore brain's pathways when they are activated in different states of mind wondering,  mindfulness meditation and embodied pleasure.. You will discover that state of mindfulness and states of pleasure encompass different brain regions that span distinct neuronal pathway. In other words, if you are feeling down, meditating alone will not necessarily enhance pleasure in your life. However just as meditation, pleasure can be a learned skill in which we train ourselves. 

Not only this experience will deepen your awareness of your own body, but as fantastic as it may sound, you will begin to learn how to sense neural pathways in your partners or your clients..  This will provide you with nuggets of wisdom that will enrich your own well-being as well  help other to live fuller and more pleasurable lives. Moreover, learn how this skill can be used to help treat a wide variety of debilitating conditions such as anxiety, eating disorders and trauma. 

We promise that that it will be simple and  easy, and fun and comes with everything you need to get started on life of embodied pleasure.  So register now at  http://www.meetup.com/Exploring-Energy-Intimacy/events/226156160/

To learn more visit www.healingwithouteffort.com or

https://www.facebook.com/healingwithoutef
results.name: Deepen Your Capacity for Pleasure: Exploring Pleasure Circuitry of the Brain

results.description:
DELICIOUS DINNER

(and Take-Out)

Prepared by

DAVID SNIECKUS

- MACROBIOTIC CHEF AND COUNSELOR - At 7 p.m.

at David’s, Margaret’s and Abigail's home in Newton, MA

October 30, 2015 menu

Lentil Soup

Brown Rice Tempeh with Sauerkraut

Mashed Squash

Broccoli and Kale

Green Salad

Mocha Pudding with Raspberries and Tofu Cream Sauce

Kukicha Tea

(see detailed logistics below.)

*****************************

Followed by a presentation

FROM THE AGE OF REASON TO THE AGE OF CONSCIOUS CREATION INSPIRED BY SPIRIT with Barry Harris from 8 to 10 pm 

THE GOOD NEWS: WE ARE TRANSITIONING FROM THE AGE OF REASON TO THE AGE OF CONSCIOUS CREATION, INSPIRED BY SPIRIT.

Awareness and responsibility for what our consciousness is doing, moment to moment, by focusing on our inner life, is the source of our happiness, power, and health. It is not something figured out by reason, distracted into focus on the outside world. See this, and experience why spirituality in our lives is so important.

When one experiences that one's experience of reality is being created from inside-out instead of passively received from outside-in, one is motivated to focus within and take responsibility for what consciousness is creating. This is the way the mystic sees reality, and it is the key to psychic freedom. Modern physics and modern philosophy are proving that this is the way reality actually is.

Realize one is a "creator" of one's experience of reality, including one's body, and not an "understander" of the outside world, and miracles start to make sense. In addition, Barry will share the latest scientific discoveries (from the Institute of Noetic Science Conference in Chicago) supporting that consciousness, not matter, is primary in the universe.

Suggested donation $10.

Barry Harris majored in quantum physics in college, attended a “New Universe” workshop taught by David Bohm (one of the most significant theoretical physicists of the 20th century), and Karl Pribram (who showed the brain as the decoder of holograms), and took a weeklong course with Karl Pribram’s graduate student assistant. Barry also worked at the Hippocrates Institute in Boston, writing health booklets for Dr. Ann Wigmore, discoverer of wheatgrass and founder of the live food movement. Hippocrates Institute is a unique healing center with a powerful spiritual focus, and an extreme dietary regime which often attracted clients who Western medicine had labeled terminally ill. While there Barry witnessed many miraculous recoveries. Later Barry witnessed more miracles while working for four years in various centers around the U.S. founded by Viktoras Kulvinskas, Dr. Wigmore's Director.

Obsessed with the secret to miracles, Barry did 20 years of independent research connecting quantum physics to Energy Medicine, cellular biology, mind/body medicine, effect of emotions on health, etc. Barry's research has been the source for the course "Beggars At God's Banquet: Miracles Are Our Birthright" which he has been presenting for the past nine years. Barry's book "Beggars At God's Banquet" based on the contents of the course will be published by X-Libris Publishing in the spring.

Barry is also a singer/voice teacher who teaches "Voice as a Path of Spiritual and Emotional Healing". His voice students learn the relationship of ego to breath patterns, and how to surrender control to a higher power. Barry is qualified to teach about miracles, because he had his own miracle. He restored his singing voice by recognizing the need for spiritual grace and surrender of control to a higher power, after Western doctors said he had damaged his voice beyond repair.

******************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community and enjoy a healthy meal!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!
results.name: Community Dinner and Conscious Creation Inspired by Spirit w/ Barry Harris

Barry also worked at the Hippocrates Institute in Boston, writing health booklets for Dr. Ann Wigmore, discoverer of wheatgrass and founder of the live food movement. Hippocrates Institute is a unique healing center with a powerful spiritual focus, and an extreme dietary regime which often attracted clients who Western medicine had labeled terminally ill.  While there Barry witnessed many miraculous recoveries.  Later Barry witnessed more miracles while working for four years in various centers around the U.S. founded by Viktoras Kulvinskas, Dr. Wigmore's Director.

Obsessed with the secret to miracles, Barry did 20 years of independent research connecting quantum physics to Energy Medicine, cellular biology, mind/body medicine, effect of emotions on health, etc.

Barry's research has been the source for the course "Beggars At God's Banquet: Miracles Are Our Birthright" which he has been presenting for the past nine years. Barry's book "Beggars At God's Banquet" based on the contents of the course will be published by X-Libris Publishing in the spring.

Barry is also a singer/voice teacher who teaches "Voice as a Path of Spiritual and Emotional Healing".  His voice students learn the relationship of ego to breath patterns, and how to surrender control to a higher power.  Barry is qualified to teach about miracles, because he had his own miracle.  He restored his singing voice by recognizing the need for spiritual grace and surrender of control to a higher power, after Western doctors said he had damaged his voice beyond repair.

******************

results.description:
Hello to all the energy and ecstasy exploreres! I am so excited to announce our next meetup! 

What would your life be like if you could experience every aspect of your private life and your work life from a state of ecstatic embodied pleasure?  Especially in the midst of stresses and uncertainties of life, when most of us have a hard time just staying in the body due to past trauma, or ongoing life challenges? Did you know you can train your brain to be in a pleasure state at will and almost instantly.

What would your life be like if you could experience every aspect of your private life and your work life from a state of ecstatic embodied pleasure?  Especially in the midst of stresses and uncertainties of life, when most of us have a hard time just staying in the body due to past trauma, or ongoing life challenges?  Did you know you can train your brain to be in a pleasure state at will and almost instantly?

I have recently returned from presenting at a Canadian Energy Psychology Conference on Neurobiology of Embodied Pleasure.  Those who came to my session hailed it as a highlight of their conference experience. They told me that everything they learned was new and leading edge, something they did not know or experienced before..  So, make sure you don't miss this opportunity as I offer an encore presentation to the energy explorers  of this meetup.  

The neurochemistry of pleasure has always been one of the brain's greatest mysteries -- difficult to define, and equally difficult to miss when it happens.  Thanks to increasing neuroimaging technology, we have ideas of where certain responses live in our brains.

Everyone is welcome to this energy  play-shop as you will journey directly into the experience of your own brain. You will have a rare opportunity to explore brain's pathways when they are activated in different states of mind wondering,  mindfulness meditation and embodied pleasure.. You will discover that state of mindfulness and states of pleasure encompass different brain regions that span distinct neuronal pathway. In other words, if you are feeling down, meditating alone will not necessarily enhance pleasure in your life. However just as meditation, pleasure can be a learned skill in which we train ourselves. 

Not only this experience will deepen your awareness of your own body, but as fantastic as it may sound, you will begin to learn how to sense neural pathways in your partners or your clients..  This will provide you with nuggets of wisdom that will enrich your own well-being as well  help other to live fuller and more pleasurable lives. Moreover, learn how this skill can be used to help treat a wide variety of debilitating conditions such as anxiety, eating disorders and trauma. 

We promise that that it will be simple and  easy, and fun and comes with everything you need to get started on life of embodied pleasure.  

To learn more visit www.healingwithouteffort.com or

https://www.facebook.com/healingwithoutef
results.name: Deepen Your Capacity for Pleasure: Exploring Pleasure Circuitry of the Brain

results.description:
In this workshop Michele will illustrate the Max/MSP graphic programming environment. From its inception Max/MSP has been conceived as platform where musicians take advantage of audio programming tools and experiment with modular approaches to compose and synthesize their sounds, without having to code. As the name suggests, Max/MSP is a combination of two main programming components: one (Max) implements a traditional command-line structure while the other, MSP, deals with digital sound processing. In the workshop the “double-nature” of the program will be illustrated in various examples. The “open” character of the platform has stimulated the creation of a wealth of new techniques in the field of sound manipulation, analysis and (live) computer-human interaction. Some of these techniques will be discussed. The workshop is intended to “whet the appetite” for more rather than giving an exhaustive illustration of the endless creative possibilities of such tool.

Michele Zaccagnini is an electronic and acoustic composer who teaches electroacoustic composition and music business at Brandeis University.His most recent project creates an interactive musical experience in which the listener’s brain-waves are harnessed to shape the musical output (neurofeedback) by means of an encephalogram device. His music has received wide recognition and awards both in the US and in Europe. The results of his research are currently being published by Ircam (Institut de Recherche et Coordination Acoustique/Musique) in Paris and by Perspectives of New Music.
results.name: Programming Music with Max/MSP [10/30] #FREE

results.description:
This is a great opportunity to practice your social photography skills, photographing complete strangers. If you have an off-camera flash you'll also learn about Rembrandt Lighting in a dramatic setting. If you don't, you'll learn why it's a good investment but you'll still get some interesting pictures.

We'll meet at the designated area for a brief discussion on equipment, technique and some useful locations to monitor. I'll show you how I shoot this type of scene, and what settings work for me. You'll also learn how to ask permission, pose subjects, and manage photo bombers.

After that you're free to wander, explore, and practice street photography at its finest.

This will be my sixth year photographing "Halloween Fashions". To see images from prior events, check out my collection on Flickr [here]

Check that your camera has fresh batteries, especially if you are using the built-in flash on your camera -- better if you bring a spare battery.

venue.name: Gilliland Observatory of the Museum of Science Parking Garage

results.description:
Fridays, March – mid-November | 8:30 – 10:00 pm
Offering Format: Public Event
Recommended for grades Pre-K – 12 and adults
Museum of Science
Free

Did you know that the Museum offers our starry-eyed public a free evening full of astronomy-themed fun on weather-cooperative Fridays?

Between 8:30pm and 10pm each Friday, weather-permitting, visit the Gilliland Observatory on the roof of the Museum’s parking garage. On clear nights, you can view stars, planets, the Moon, and other astronomical phenomena. On cloudy nights, tour the inside of our Observatory, and participate in astronomy-related activities run by our knowledgeable staff.

This program does not run on nights when the weather is inclement. For more details, and to find out if Astronomy After Hours is running on a given Friday, call our hotline,[masked]-0267. We update each Friday by 5:30pm with the evening’s plans.

Astronomy After Hours runs seasonally, from the first Friday in March to the last Friday before Thanksgiving. Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute (parking charges still apply).

Thanks to Don Doughty for letting us know about the museum.

Source: http://www.mos.org/public-events/astronomy-after-hours
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet 15 minutes before the scheduled time and to the right of the line in front of the Astronomy building on the roof of the Museum of Science to be with the group. The Meetup group will wait for 10 minutes and then get in line.
results.name: Astronomy After Hours - Museum of Science

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]

=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to three of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Jefferson, Adams, and Madison. We will use Caps Ridge Trail to reach Jefferson and then we will follow Gulfside Trail and some other trails to reach Adams and then Madison. From there we will use Valley Way to get to the trailhead. There will be a few steep sections on the way up to Jefferson and then we will be above treeline for most of the day. The Madison Spring Hut is already closed for the season.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 12 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 10.4 miles and climb about 4,400 feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours 30 minutes to complete. This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/2-Mt-Adams-5774--5-Mt-Madison-5367


http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/3-Mt-Jefferson-5712


Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants. Use this link for the current weather forecast:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lon=-71.29269327215584&lat=44.32131078136757#.ViWJZrTO5_Y


=== What to Bring ===


IT'S WINTER IN THE MOUNTAINS - WINTER CLOTHING AND GEAR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS HIKE. DON'T THINK WE WILL NEED SNOWSHOES BUT WINTER BOOTS, TRACTION, AND WEATHER APPROPRIATE CLOTHING IS REQUIRED. EXPERIENCE IN WINTER IS ALSO REQUIRED.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:


</a>http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the AppalachiaTrailhead which is located on the south side of Route 2 near Gorham, NH. According to Google Maps this spot is about 170 miles from Boston and it will take about 2 hours 45 minutes to drive there. Since that is where we will end our trip we will leave a few cars there and drive to the start.

Use this link to customize the driving directions:

<a href="https://goo.gl/maps/D8E8SgFqMat">https://goo.gl/maps/TTBfdekWgMq


While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu/plants/interactive-map/

http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu/plants/interactive-map/

http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu

With thousands of species of flora from around the world living on its 281 acres, the Arnold Arboretum offers boundless opportunity to explore the natural world in a managed landscape.  There is something happening in every season, most especially in fall with vibrant colors spread through every corner.

We will definitely visit the Maples Collection just a short walk down Meadow Road, but BCC field trippers are welcome to wander wherever their hearts desire.

Much more info on the Arnold Arboretum at <a>http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu.</a>;

Interactive map of the grounds is at  http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu/plants/interactive-map/.

Photo Credit: "Maples in Fall" by Erik Gehring.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in front of the Hunnewell Building by the main gate of the Arboretum.
results.name: Photograph Fall Color in the Arnold Arboretum

results.description:
You must register at the following link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/breaking-the-barriers-digital-health-and-innovation-for-the-healthcare-professional-tickets-17685265104


Join Boston Young Healthcare Professionals (BYHP) in its first healthcare conference! With the evolution of digital health and healthcare innovation, BYHP has gathered leaders from across healthcare to drive discussions about the current state of digital health and innovation, and what the future will hold in this growing space. We will also have interactive workshops that will teach attendees how to think more like an innovator and how they can apply these skills to their everyday work. By the end of this conference, the audience should leave with a toolkit that will empower them to make an impact in their current roles and beyond.

 In addition to three keynotes, attendees will have the option to select three of six panel sessions when they register for the event. Our panels are broken out into two tracks:

(1) The Intrapreneuer Series will focus on an emerging trend within digital health, giving attendees the knowledge of the topic's current state and how it will evolve over time. With panelists that span the healthcare industry, you will be able to hear multiple perspectives on these topics. 

(2)  The Disruptor Series will focus on professional development, giving attendees a toolbox that will allow them to tackle healthcare issues from a new angle. These workshops will be more interactive. Because of this, seating for these sessions will be limited.

 To end the conference, we will have a networking and startup-demo session. Attendees will get a chance to network with others and experience healthcare innovations firsthand as startups from around Boston will be displaying prototypes of their products.

Other Information

* Food and drink will be provided during the conference.

* Current BYHP members will receive an e-mail with a discount code which will give them 50% off the ticket price.

* Non-members who purchase an annual BYHP Membership between July 28th, 2015 to October 30th, 2015 will receive a discount code that will give them 60% off the ticket price. Note that the discount code will be sent in approximately 72 hours from the time you register to become a member. For more information on BYHP Membership benefits, please click here.

10:50 - 11:05      Break

                            Disruptor Panel: Disrupting Healthcare with Lateral Thinking

11:50 - 12:30      Lunch (provided)

12:30 - 1:15        Intrapreneur Panel: Transforming Healthcare Through Patient Engagment

                            Disruptor Panel: The Collsion of Healthcare Data and Empathy

1:15 - 2:00          Intrapreneur Panel: Transforming Healthcare Delivery Through Digital Tech

                            Disruptor Panel: The Life of a Healthcare Entrepreneur

2:00 - 2:15         Break

2:15 - 3:00         Brant Cooper, NYT Bestselling Author of The Lean Entrepreneur


3:00 - 3:10         Closing Remarks

3:10 - 5:00         Startup Demo + Networking (Drink ticket to be provided)

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
We are absolutely thrilled to welcome Tammi Sweet, one of katja’s personal heros, to teach a special weekend workshop at our school Saturday October 31 & Sunday November 1. Tammi will be teaching on one of her favorite topics: stress and the way our bodies respond to it! She’ll weave information about the nervous system, the endocrine system, the endo-cannibinoid system, and the heart as an organ of perception into a in-depth picture of how our bodies understand our environment. Tammi will also teach on perceptual thinking patterns: how we learn and perceive the world – which is so central to how we’re able, or not able!, to manage stressful encounters. And of course, she’ll ground it all with her favorite herbs for stressful times, and for supporting the body’s stress and relaxation responses!

If you’re a practicing herbalist, a teacher, a therapist, a massage therapist, or a human living on this earth in this time: this workshop is for you! And what better time than the turning of the seasons to be doing this work: the perfect Halloween Treat!

This class may qualify for 4-6 CEU credits for massage therapists, further details will follow.

The fee for this workshop is on a sliding scale, $120 – $250. In order to attend, you MUST REGISTER for this workshop by emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

Saturday, October 31 & Sunday, November 1, 2015
9am – 5pm Saturday, 9am – 1pm Sunday.
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline
results.name: Tammi Sweet: Stress, Relaxation, and the Heart

results.description:
Join the L.L.Bean Dedham store for a 4-mile historic hike through Noanet Woodlands. We'll ascend to Noanet Peak where granite bluffs offer a view of the Boston skyline, before heading toward a ruined 19th century Iron Works.

ACTIVITY LEVEL: Easy.

WHERE TO MEET: In the Noanet Woodlands Trustees parking lot on Powisset Ave.

WHAT TO BRING: Weather-appropriate clothing, hiking worthy footwear, sunglasses, enough water for 2+ hours.

OPTIONAL RECOMMENDED ITEMS: Sunglasses, binoculars, cameras, snacks.

Sign up at LLBean.com/Dedham find the event and fill out the online waiver
results.how_to_find_us: Anne will be our guide.  Look for a large white SUV with stand up paddleboard racks on it in the parking lot.
results.name: Hike the Ironworks at Noanet Woodlands

results.description:
I wish that all of nature's magnificence, the emotion of the land, the living energy of a place could be photographed. Annie Leibovitz.

Last weekend I went to scout a new location for our workshops at the suggestion of one of our members. (Thank you Larry!) What I discovered at this location was so stunning I had two immediate reactions. One was, Oh I can't wait to bring the group here, and the other was, Oh I am so glad to be here all by myself. There was such a special quality of peace, beauty and tranquility it felt almost like discovering a secret urban sanctuary. 

I had had a terrible technology week and after just 3 hours photographing these landscapes, I felt revitalized and renewed. I truly think beauty in nature brings us back to ourselves when we get too busy and cast away. Join me to slow down and breath next Saturday.  The forest is deep, the stones are ancient, and the water is crystal clear. 


Reflection of Echo Bridge.


So my dilemma was, should I keep this secret place to myself or share it with you? As a compromise I have decided to take just a small group here next week. I am eager to share the beauty of this location with a few of you and help you see like an artist.

Finding your path step by step. 

 I don't feel it is appropriate to bring a large group. (We had 20 for the Mount Auburn Cemetery shoot.) This location will be best for those of you who have attended at least 3 of my workshops in the past. This way I will know you have some of the foundational pieces and can focus on some deeper ways of seeing that I want to introduce at this time. You will need to know your basic camera operation choices so you can shoot in both aperture and shutter priority with a little help from me. I may take beginners here in the Spring.

Finding beauty in chaos.

Some of the topics I will cover:


How to choose the most compelling composition to capture the spirit of the space.

How to translate your experience of nature into a photograph.

How to work with reflections and colors to find simplicity within visual chaos.

How to capture waterfalls in two different ways, freeze action and flow motion.

Because I am keeping the group size small, I will be able to spend more time with each of you so this session will feel like a semi private lesson. As always, I will touch upon the three fundamentals of good photography, creative SEEING, DOING the right thing technically, and BEING in tune with the subject.


It is also necessary that you be very steady on your feet. The path is steep in some spots and a bit rocky. You can take your time and find the easy path but you must have good hiking shoes or sneakers.

View from on top of the bridge we will hike to.

So to summarize this special workshop is for you if:

• You have attended a minimum of 3 workshops with me.

• You are steady on your feet and have good walking shoes

• You are familiar with your basic camera settings.

Logistics: You can reach this location on the green line. Take Riverside (D) train. I will provide more details once you RSVP. There is also a small public parking lot near the entrance where we will start if you are driving.

Since this is a Silver Level Program, I will also be providing you with more in-depth critique of one of your photos from the day. When you post your photos, please indicate the image you would most like to receive constructive instructional feedback on.  

This amazing creature showed up just as I was about to leave. With luck, if we are very quiet and still, he will pose for you next weekend as well. 

Yet another example of stunning colors, reflections and textures a this location. I can't wait to go back and take you with me. 

Suzanne

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

If there's no parking in Thorndike lot, look for parking on the side streets.

results.description:
(a set of 4 Saturday classes)


Always wanted to learn how they really fought in the middle ages? Forget any ideas about crude battering on armour; the successful warrior strikes to the gaps and the openings of his or her opponent's attacks, and supplements this with disarms, throws, and other techniques which secure the advantage over larger or stronger attackers.

Around the year 1400, Fiore dei Liberi trained medieval knights and squires, and authored multiple books of medieval combat, some of which have survived to the present day. His method, L'Arte d'Armizare (the Art of Bearing Arms), shows an integrated and cross-referenced system of sword, dagger, grappling, spear & lance, pollaxe and other weapons on foot and on horseback, with and without armour, and easily dispels any illusions that medieval combat was about unskilled strength.

Our beginners' course is four linked classes that give the basic techniques and vocabulary of L'Arte, and enables men and women to begin regular unarmoured training and learning.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

So, come join the scholars and combatants of our company!

(The price shown is for the set of all four classes (Oct 24, 31, Nov. 7 and 14) and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  We'll send an email with some class materials before the first session.)

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

This is the first place winner of the poll.  Quite a few of you recommended this book, so I'm sure it must be an interesting read.  Please see the below information about the book.  See y'all then.

“This is your country, this is your world, this is your body, and you must find some way to live within the all of it.”

 In a profound work that pivots from the biggest questions about American history and ideals to the most intimate concerns of a father for his son, Ta-Nehisi Coates offers a powerful new framework for understanding our nation’s history and current crisis. Americans have built an empire on the idea of “race,” a falsehood that damages us all but falls most heavily on the bodies of black women and men—bodies exploited through slavery and segregation, and, today, threatened, locked up, and murdered out of all proportion. What is it like to inhabit a black body and find a way to live within it? And how can we all honestly reckon with this fraught history and free ourselves from its burden? 

Between the World and Me is Ta-Nehisi Coates’s attempt to answer these questions in a letter to his adolescent son. Coates shares with his son—and readers—the story of his awakening to the truth about his place in the world through a series of revelatory experiences, from Howard University to Civil War battlefields, from the South Side of Chicago to Paris, from his childhood home to the living rooms of mothers whose children’s lives were taken as American plunder. Beautifully woven from personal narrative, reimagined history, and fresh, emotionally charged reportage, Between the World and Me clearly illuminates the past, bracingly confronts our present, and offers a transcendent vision for a way forward.
results.name: Let's Read and Discuss:  Between the World and Me by Ta-Nehisi Coates

results.description:
NOTE: this is meetup is on a Saturday rather than the usual Sunday. 


We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

results.description:
Que es la vida? asks Pedro Calderon de la Barca's classic drama Life Is a Dream (La Vida es Sueño). The story follows Prince Segismundo, whose father has locked him in a tower to disprove a prophecy that his son will turn into an evil tyrant. The prince is forced into a life of extreme poverty, filth and discomfort, until he wakes in a castle, surrounded by luxuries and beauty. Which is real? Which is illusion? The play is among the finest examples of Spanish Golden Age drama and it gets a fresh revision in this new translation by Emerson Performing Arts Chair Melia Bensussen, performed by student production company Emerson Stage. Get swept away by the production that's become known as "The Spanish Hamlet" when it comes to the Jackie Liebergott Black Box Theatre in Boston.


Yes this is on Halloween but it's a matinee so there will be plenty of time to get to Halloween parties after!


CLICK HERE FOR DISCOUNTED TICKETS SO WE CAN SIT TOGETHER!
results.how_to_find_us: Use the link below for so we can get a discount and sit together!
results.name: Life Is a Dream: New Adaptation of the 17th Century Spanish Masterpiece

results.description:
Every year, NESFA hosts an Annual Halloween Party/OM (Other Meeting) at the clubhouse. The doors are open with plenty of people inside, all having refreshments and trading hilarious convention stories.

 Costumes are optional and we will have candy for the kids (and the adults as well) available.

  This year, your mission, should you choose to accept, is to keep Bill T away from the candy. Although Bill T has dropped his sugar intake considerably, he has left one day per week to eat sugary things. Needless to say, Halloween is going to be that day of that week. That being said, though, there is a limit to how much Bill T should eat, and stopping him will not be easy as he's one of the sneakiest people you've ever met. Hint: distracting Bill T with a game helps slow him down.

 Also worth noting is that, if Disney decides to, once again, air Star Wars Rebels on channel 7, you'll see a group run into the blue room to watch it on tv.

 There is talk (it's not set in stone at this point) of a horror movie marathon starting directly after the party finishes and everything is cleaned up. You've been warned.

 As always there is never any fee or charge to come in and partake in one of NESFAs events held at the clubhouse, nor do you have to be a member, nor do you have to join. All you have to do is open the door and have fun. Hope to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: www.nesfa.org is the website. The clubhouse is directly between a high-end convenience/liquor store and White Sport Pizza & Subs. Look for the door with the giant shield on it, directly left of the mailbox.

results.description:
We will practice together, play and study theory.

Usually we get quite a few beginners, so if you are just starting don't be shy, you definitely can join us. If you have been playing for some time I am sure you will find a few helpful ideas as well. If the level will be very different then we might divide it to two groups eventually.

Half of the class time is dedicated to a consecutive curriculum. We try to choose themes that are relevant to everybody in the class. We might talk about some aspects of technique, or reading, or theory etc. The other half of the class time we usually help students with their individual issues and questions.

We see this class as a supportive and motivational environment for your self-teaching process. There are two experienced guitar teachers (Anastasiya Dumma and David Lee), both Berklee grads, who are ready to answer all your questions and suggest new things to practice!

This is PAY-WHAT-YOU-WANT class. We kindly ask you to support your teachers and Westland Guitars that provided the space. Online donations feel a bit inconvenient (sorry), so you can contribute when you come to the class.

results.description:
Boston's most anticipated, most fun, and SPOOKIEST bike ride is back, and this time it's going to be bigger and better than ever. On Halloween Night we slither and crawl through the streets with jaw dropping costumes, ear popping tunes, and traffic stopping magnitude!

Website: http://halloweenbikeride.net 


Route: 10 miles, Boston & Cambridge 

Final Destination: Secret Outdoor Dance Party!

Join a Neighborhood Bike Convoy to Copley Square:

Jamaica Plain, Dorchester, Cambridge / MIT, Boston University,Southie, Somerville (Union),Somerville (Davis), Allston, orRoxbury


====We're Riding a little differently this year====


Boston Halloween Bike Ride has grown a whole lot in the past 16 years, with over 750 riders in 2014 (wow!). In previous years, volunteer ride marshals held car traffic at intersections so the group could stay together through intersections. Unfortunately, this system starts to break down when we have more than a few hundred people, and we passed that tipping point in 2014. We learned that it's nearly impossible to hold intersections for more than a few minutes without angering drivers, and putting volunteers in danger. This year, we’re changing to a different marshalling format where volunteers won’t hold car traffic at intersections. Instead,


*Riders will follow all traffic rules, stopping at stop signs and red lights.

*Volunteer Ride Marshals will stand on the sidewalk and tell you when to turn.

*As a rider, just keep riding straight until you see a volunteer directing you to turn!

*We’ll have a secret outdoor dance party stop along the way for you to catch up with your friends!

This way, everyone knows where to ride to stay on route, nobody gets lost, and we minimize tension between riders and drivers. Win win win!


==============================

This year's banner artwork by: Mikk Olli
results.name: 16th Annual Boston Halloween Bike Ride

results.description:
* COSTUMES ENCOURAGED BUT NOT REQUIRED

Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth. Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity." If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker! It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit <a>www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.</a>

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up. Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

Drafts, Well Drinks, Halloween!

results.description:
I realize that lots of you have plans on Halloween....but others of us may not...

I started thinking about the concept of 'costumes'...and although I really don't like 'scary' costumes at all, I thought...are they 'fun'? 

Are costumes exclusively for Halloween and Carnivale & other festivals, or do we often put on a 'mask' or a 'costume' to feel more  comfortable in life/work/etc.? If so, what kind of mask/costume do you think people choose most often? 

If you do, what's yours? 

Does that mean we are not being 'authentic' out in public, or is it just another way of being 'us'?


Let's discuss over some good Thai/Chinese/Japaneset food........

Feel free to come 'in costume' if you want to!! :)

(once again, I reserve the right to postpone or cancel this event if there are less than five people attending.)
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for Beverly's Table

results.description:
We're hosting another big Halloween bash this year! We're renting out a private hall and will have music and dancing, dinner, games, decorations and a costume contest with cash prizes. We'll be at the same location as last year with plenty of room to spread out, dance, and play games.

We will have to charge admission to cover the cost of the event.  Early admission is $20 per person through the month of September.  The fee will go up to $25 per person starting on October 1st, so buy early and save!

RSVPs will close a week before the event- so don't wait until the last minute!


Costume contest: First place is $100, second place is $50, third place is $25, so come in costume and be prepared to compete! There is no "theme" for the party or the contest, so let your imagination run wild.

Food: Dinner is being catered by Talk of the Town Catering and the menu will be confirmed once I get an idea of how many people are coming and dietary needs (question to answer when registering). 

Drinks: A full cash bar [PLEASE NOTE THAT CASH BAR MEANS ACTUAL CASH AND NOT CREDIT CARDS] will be on site. Beer and mixed drinks are around $4 per and wine around $3.50 per. Pitchers of water will be available at no cost.


Location: We will be at Coastie Joe's at the US Coast Guard Base. It's a short walk from the Haymarket T-stop (Green and Orange line) and the Aquarium stop on the blue line. There will be parking available for those who drive. The address is 427 Commercial St., Boston, MA  02109. Please note that you will need to show a valid ID (US Passport or a state issued Driver's License/ID) to get onto the base and join the fun.


Last but not least, while we have to charge a cost for this party, we've tried very hard to keep costs as low as possible. No one is making any money off this event, all the money we collect is going into making this party a fantastic night to remember and meetup costs. (Since I know people will ask if it is possible to not pre-pay and pay in person on the night of the party, the answer is no.) 

We hope to see you there!
results.name: 2015 Halloween Party and Costume Contest! NEW DATE!!!

results.description:
For everyone not having plans for Halloween evening. Pretty much everybody will be out and about scaring others, as this is a Saturday night. Costume is optional. :)

We will explore the Charlestown Navy Yard, a part of historical Boston and its Freedom Trail. Unlimited photo opportunities of maritime and city views along this one mile walk. Sun sets at 7 pm, you can catch some nice afterglow over the city shooting from the east-most side. Come earlier if you want to shoot the sunset, but please be at the meeting point at 7:15. The 77% waning moon comes up at 8:18 pm. This is an easy to intermediate level photo shoot.


The USS Constitution is currently in dry dock, not in the water, and may not be very visible.


See the below image on where to meet. It is the bus pull-out at the main entrance to the yard, corner of Consititution Ave, Freedom Trail and 1st Ave. You need to use a browser to view images, the mobile app doesn't show them. 

From there, we will move east along the waterfront to see the ships pulled up, the dry dock and yard equipment.See photos of a prior visit here and here.


Suggested equipment:

Dress warmly in layers, it will be mid to upper 40s with 30% cloud cover (cloud streaks!), some wind. Any lens will work, plenty of opportunities to zoom in or go wide. Tripod and intervalometer


Parking:

Pilgrim Parkinghttps://plus.google.com/100682448617069155452/about%3Fgl%3Dus%26hl%3Den&s=ANYYN7mveQ-obUnanvev4sOprwtP8kkUJw&dtab=2">, 88 Constitution Road, Charlestown, Massachusetts 02129 and limited street parking
results.name: Halloween Night At the Navy Yard

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
